description: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,0)=T(n,n)=1 for n >= 0; for n >= 2 and 1<=k<=n-1, T(n,k)=T(n-1,k-1)+T(n-2,k-1)+T(n-1,k) if n is odd and k=(n-1)/2, else T(n,k)=T(n-1,k-1)+T(n-1,k).
links: Rob Arthan, Comments on A026674, A026725, A026670
formula: T(n, k) = number of paths from (0, 0) to (n-k, k) in directed graph having vertices (i, j) and edges (i, j)-to-(i+1, j) and (i, j)-to-(i, j+1) for i, j >= 0 and edges (i, i+1)-to-(i+1, i+2) for i >= 0.Comment from _Rick L. Shepherd_, Aug 05 2002: Probably this should be changed to "and edges (i+1, i)-to-(i+2, i+1) for i >= 0."
author: _Clark Kimberling_
